intro: Pleocnemia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate pleocnemia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
